abstract: Sixteen New York City employees from Department of Buildings and Department of Housing Preservation and Development are arrested and charged in city-wide building inspection bribery schemes; dozens of property managers, owners, expediters and construction workers also face charges; cases highlight underside of city's current real estate boom.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors say 16 city employees exploited their positions to obtain hundreds of thousands of dollars in bribes. Dozens of property managers and owners, expediters and other construction workers also face charges.

headline.main: New York City Buildings Inspectors Charged in Bribe Schemes
headline.print_headline: City Buildings Inspectors Charged in Bribe Schemes

snippet: Prosecutors say 16 city employees exploited their positions to obtain hundreds of thousands of dollars in bribes. Dozens of property managers and owners, expediters and other construction workers also face charges.
